result.execSummary:
The defendant Eli J. Eckerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on 11/22/16
from Pre-Trial Supervision Program Case Manager dated November 21, 2016
original filed in 14CF212

Defendant Eli J. Eckerson in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Eli J. Eckerson in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF390, 16CF438, 16GF203, 14CF212, 15CF3 and 15CF260.

1:36 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court questions the parties regarding 16CF390 and 16CF438.
Atty Knaapen indicates (and wants stated on the record) that all counts on 16CF390 and 16CF438 are going to be DRI and DRI uncharged count(s) in 16GF203.
Atty Kryshak makes statements on the record.  

BTC:  All counts on 16CF390 and 16CF438 are DRI and uncharged count(s) on 16GF203 are DRI.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Knaapen and Atty Kryshak have no changes or corrections on the PSI
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
State has complied with victim notification; 1 victim appeared in Court but did not wish to make a statement.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Atty Knaapen provides victim impact statements to the Court.
Defendant makes a statment prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
***14CF212:
**Count 1 -
Sentenced to 44 months in prison
20 months initial confinement 
38 days credit
24 months of extended supervision
**Conditions of extended supervision:
No contact with Dylan Winkler.
No contact with Charles Worth, Carol Worth, Carrie Worth and/or Joshua White.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Take medications only as prescribed by a physician
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Comply with other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by his agent.
Sign appropriate releases.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

**Count 2 -
Pay $300 fine plus costs
Sentenced to 6 months in the county jail to run concurrent with Count 1
38 days jail credit 
12 month driver license revocation effective as of today's date 11/22/16

Count 3 - DRI

***15CF3:
**Count 1 -
Sentenced to 50 months in prison - concurrent to 14CF212
26 months  initial confinement 
38 days jail credit
24 months of extended supervision
**Conditions of extended supervision:
Comply with conditions in count 1 of 14CF212
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay restitution in the amount of $150 to J.W.

**Count 4 -
Sentenced to 6 months in County jail - concurrent to Count 1 and 14CF212
38 days jail credit
Pay costs

Count 2, 3, 5-8 - DRI

***15CF260:
**Count 1 -
Sentenced to 40 months  in prison - concurrent to Count 2, 3 & 4 and 14CF212 and 15CF3
20 months initial confinement 
38 days jail credit
20 months of extended supervision
**Conditions of extended supervision:
Comply with conditions in count 1 of 14CF212
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

**Count 2 -
Sentenced to 40 months in prison - concurrent to Count 1, 3 & 4 and 14CF212 and 15CF3
20 months initial confinement 
20 months of extended supervision
**Conditions of extended supervision:
Comply with conditions in count 1 of 14CF212
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

**Count 3 -
Sentenced to 40 months in prison - concurrent to Count 1, 2 & 4 and 14CF212 and 15CF3
20 months initial confinement 
20 months of extended supervision
**Conditions of extended supervision:
Comply with conditions in count 1 of 14CF212
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

**Count 4 -
Sentenced to 40 months in prison - concurrent to Count 1, 2 & 3 and 14CF212 and 15CF3
20 months initial confinement 
20 months of extended supervision
**Conditions of extended supervision:
Comply with conditions in count 1 of 14CF212
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 5-8 - DRI

**Cash bond(s) to be applied to 15CF3 the restitution in the amount of $150 and remaining balance to be applied to any fines/costs.

20 days to appeal 
Defendant is remanded to the Wisconsin State Prison System
Sentencing hearing on November 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from DOC - request extension for PSI - Original filed in 14CF212
Sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing at 06-24-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Eli J. Eckerson in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-86, 14CF-212, 14CF-380, 14CF-317, 14CF-367, 15CF-260, 14CF-318, 15CF-3 and 14CF-458. 

1:41 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea hearing at this time.

14CF212-State has filed an amended information, amending Count 2.  
Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2.
Count 3 would be dismissed and read in.

15CF3 - Defendant will plead to Count 1 as charged and Count 4 as charged.
Counts 2 and 3 and 5 thorough 8 would be dismissed and read in

15CF260 - Defendant will plead to the first 4 counts.
Remaining counts will be dismissed and read in.

14CF317, 14CF318, 14CF367, 14CF380, 14CF458 and 15CF86 will be dismissed and read in

State requests a PSI but the State agrees that if Defendant does not receive any new charges from now till sentencing that the State will request a withheld sentence, probation and jail.

Atty Kryshak concurs.

Atty Kryshak has reviewed the amended information with his client and waives reading, will enter pleas of NO CONTEST to all charges.

Plea questionnaires/Agreements filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-3 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-3 Count 4

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-260 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-260 Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-260 Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-260 Count 4

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 14CF-212 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-212 Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CF-3: Count 1 Found Guilty
15CF-3: Count 2 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-3: Count 3 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-3: Count 4 Found Guilty
15CF-3: Count 5 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-3: Count 6 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-3: Count 7 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-3: Count 8 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-260: Count 1 Found Guilty
15CF-260: Count 2 Found Guilty
15CF-260: Count 3 Found Guilty
15CF-260: Count 4 Found Guilty
15CF-260: Count 5 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-260: Count 6 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-260: Count 7 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-260: Count 8 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-212: Count 1 Found Guilty
14CF-212: Count 2 Found Guilty
14CF-212: Count 3 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-317: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-318: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-367: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-380: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-458: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-86: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.

Parties are to schedule a date for sentencing with the Judicial Assistant, 60 days out.

Atty Kryshak addresses bond regarding a curfew, requests the curfew be removed in order to work. 
State has no objection to the modification.

BY THE COURT:
Bond will be modified to remove the curfew.

State files Information.

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Defendant Eli J. Eckerson in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

for OWI prusuant to Wis. Stat. 968.12
Preliminary hearing at 08-03-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Eli J. Eckerson in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT: Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Kryshak

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
Comply with all other bonds that he is currently under.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Gary Kryshak appears in Court.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Kryshak makes bond arguments to the Court.  Requests a $500 cash bond and sign a wage assignment to Rasmussen Plumbing and Heating for $100 per week. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/20/15 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
